question:
My House    I am Nisa. I live in Patokbeusi. My house is at no. 40 Jl. Raya Patokbeust. It's not big house
It's medium. It's painted grey. It has two floors. I like it anyway. It has a small garden and palm
and mango tree in front of the house. It has looks green and nice
My house has four bedrooms, two living rooms, a dining room, a kitchen and two
bathrooms. My bedroom is in the front part of the house, next to the living room. My parents' room
is in the middle part of the house next to the dining room. The kitchen and the bathroom are at the
back part of the house. I love house
very
much​

related_questions.question:
What is the climax of the strory?    True Friends

 Once upon a time, there were two close friends who were walking through the forest together. They knew that anything dangerous can happen any time in the forest. So they promised each other that they would always be together in any case of danger.

 Suddenly, they saw a large bear getting closer toward them. One of them climbed a nearby tree at once. But unfortunately the other one did not know how to climb up the tree. So being led by his common sense, he lay down on the ground breathless and pretended to be a dead man.

 The bear came near the one who was lying on the ground. It smelt in his ears, and slowly left the place because the bears do not want to touch the dead creatures. After that, the friend on the tree came down and asked his friend that was on the ground, "Friend, what did the bear whisper into your ears?" The other friend replied, "Just now the bear advised me not to believe a false friend."

 Moral of the Story- A true friend in need is a friend indeed

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Apa klimaks dari cerita tersebut?

Teman sejati

Alkisah, ada dua orang sahabat yang sedang berjalan bersama di hutan. Mereka tahu bahwa segala sesuatu yang berbahaya dapat terjadi kapan saja di hutan. Jadi mereka berjanji satu sama lain bahwa mereka akan selalu bersama dalam keadaan bahaya apa pun.

Tiba-tiba, mereka melihat seekor beruang besar mendekat ke arah mereka. Salah satu dari mereka memanjat pohon terdekat sekaligus. Namun sayangnya yang satunya tidak tahu bagaimana cara memanjat pohon tersebut. Jadi dibimbing oleh akal sehatnya, dia berbaring di tanah dengan terengah-engah dan berpura-pura menjadi orang mati.

Beruang itu mendekati orang yang terbaring di tanah. Itu tercium di telinganya, dan perlahan meninggalkan tempat itu karena beruang tidak mau menyentuh makhluk mati. Setelah itu, teman di pohon itu turun dan bertanya kepada temannya yang ada di tanah, "Teman, apa yang dibisikkan beruang ke telingamu?" Teman yang lain menjawab, "Baru saja beruang itu menasihati saya untuk tidak mempercayai teman palsu."

Moral of the Story- Teman sejati yang membutuhkan adalah teman sejati.

Semoga membantu^^

related_questions.question:
Write down the generic structure of the text about!

bantuin woi​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Generic Structure of Descriptive Text : Identification, Description

Penjelasan:

# Identification: (contains about the introduction of a person, place, animal or object will be described.)

# Description: contains a description of something such as animal, things, place or person by describing its features, forms, colors, or anything related to what the writer describe.

Jawaban:

Orientation

A mobile phone - portable radio telephone

Event

The first mobile phone - in japan

General classification

A cell phone combines - wireless communication

Description

Paragraph 2-3 is a descriptiom about phone

related_questions.question:
Change these Reported Speech into Direct Speech    1. She said she had never seen a comet.

 2. They said it had been a wonderful time.

 3. My father asked me who I played with.

 4. He told us he was going to do judo

 5. He told me he had to help his father.

 Change the Direct Speech into Reported Speech

 1. Mum asked : "Have you got the keys?"

 2. He said ; "You should listen to the teacher."

 3. The police : "Don't park here!"

 4. Susan : "Who has drunk the water?"

 5. They asked : "Why didn't you play with us?"

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Reported to Direct:

1. "I had never seen a comet," she said.

2. "It has been a wonderful time," they said.

3. My father asked me, "Who did you play with?"

4. "I'm going to do judo," he told us.

5. He said, "I have to help my father"

Direct to Reported:

1. My mum asked me if I got the keys.

2. He told me that I should listen to the teacher.

3. The police said to not park here.

4. Susan asked who had drunk the water.

5. They asked me why I didn't play with them.

Jawaban:

1.Simien national park

2.Walia ibex

3.The mountain called simien national park

4.Scarce

5.Because the population of walia ibex is getting smaller and smaller.

Jawaban:

Task 2

Present Perfect Tense

1. I have done lots of horrible jobs.

2. She has drunk milk.

3. I have eaten some pizza.

4. A cat has slept.

5. They have made it.

Penjelasan:

Semua kalimat pada jawaban di atas menggunakan bentuk Present Perfect Tense karena menjelaskan tentang aktivitas kegiatan yang sudah dilakukan di waktu lampau.

Present Perfect Tense:

(+) Subject + Have/Has + Verb-3

Semoga membantu ya.

related_questions.question:
13. Penguapan pada tumbuhan    disebut juga
transpirasi
b. kondensasi
c. evaporasi
d. revitalisasi
tolong di jawab plis

​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

a. transpirasi

Peristiwa berubahnya air menjadi uap dan bergerak dari permukaan tanah dan permukaan air ke udara disebut evaporasi (penguapan). Peristiwa penguapan dari tanaman disebut transpirasi. Kedua-duanya bersama-sama disebut Evapotranspirasi.

sumber:

https://ekaratnawati2492.wordpress.com/2012/11/14/transpirasi-pada-tumbuhan-2/#:~:text=Peristiwa%20berubahnya%20air%20menjadi%20uap%20dan%20bergerak%20dari,Evapotranspirasi.%20I.%20Kegunaan%20dan%20kerugian%20transpirasi%20terhadap%20tumbuhan.

semoga membantu!
